description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a3mgt","text":"This protocol covers the process of using Titan on the command-line, which was developed by Robert Petit at Wyoming Public Heath Laboratories. Some laboratories have the computing infrastructure and capacity to conduct local bioinformatic analyses and wish to use the Titan workflow, but not on the Terra platform. Local implementation of Titan-gc eliminates bottlenecks such as data upload to the cloud as well as offers users the ability to incorporate the process into scripts if they desire. Provided steps include how to install dependencies via Conda, create input files for the workflow, and run the pipeline directly or using a Nextflow wrapper. Basic troubleshooting tips are also discussed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6p12j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9o5v0","text":"For technical assistance, please contact: TOAST@cdc.gov","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":363,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":834,"length":12}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D0F19CEAE64911EBB2A80A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D0F19C88E64911EBB2A80A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7s9tt","text":"The Titan workflow and its dependencies can be installed using the Conda package manager and the Bioconda channel for bioinformatics software. To install Conda, follow the instructions in Step 1.1. To update an existing Conda installation, go to Step 1.2. To add the Bioconda channel, go to Step 1.3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":143,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":198,"length":40},{"style":"bold","offset":256,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":5},{"key":1,"offset":97,"length":8}],"data":[]},{"key":"7ul07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a7u8d","text":"A Bioconda recipe for titan-gc is available at: https://bioconda.github.io/recipes/titan-gc/README.html","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":48,"length":55}],"data":[]},{"key":"amt8e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bu8cc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ro3q","text":"With Conda running and an activated Bioconda channel on your machine, create a new Conda environment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3vlcm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6j27h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b8b2t","text":"This creates a new environment named titan-cli in which to install the titan-gc software. This Conda environment can be activated and deactivated as needed. When active, the environment name appears in parentheses to the left of the prompt. When deactivated, the normal prompt returns. For example: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"56ap","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6anac","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dffl0","text":"With the titan-cli environment activated, install and update the titan-gc software:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70j4n","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5tj4u","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FC7ED8A0276E11ECB27AB7017A6B1B5B","url":"https://conda.io/en/latest/index.html"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"04065620276F11ECB27AB7017A6B1B5B","url":"https://bioconda.github.io/"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F932403D277011EC86720A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://bioconda.github.io/recipes/titan-gc/README.html"}},"3":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9581,"name":"conda create -n titan-cli -c conda-forge -c bioconda titan-gc","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"B4626DE0277111ECB27AB7017A6B1B5B"}},"4":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9514,"name":"[me@PC ~]$ conda activate titan-cli\n(titan-cli) [me@PC ~]$ conda deactivate\n[me@PC~]$","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"FC903CB0E3E111EBA9C897543DABB963"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9dbvp","text":"Add the Bioconda channel, and required dependencies in the specified order, to an existing Conda installation with commands:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"55qnd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5qg7s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9582,"name":"conda config --add channels defaults\nconda config --add channels bioconda\nconda config --add channels conda-forge","os_name":"","os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"F5865F40276F11ECB27AB7017A6B1B5B"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd4jd","text":"Analyzing sequences with the titan-gc workflow requires an input file defining:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a0duc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a67q0","text":"Same name","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4rgb6","text":"Workflow","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"85e2b","text":"Sequencing read file locations","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4jl1e","text":"Primer bed file location","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"900fk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1p126","text":"ARTIC primer bed files are available at: https://github.com/artic-network/primer-schemes/tree/master/nCoV-2019 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":69}],"data":[]},{"key":"fg68g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7tbjd","text":"The input file is created using the included titan-gc-prepare.py script in the Conda environment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"atijt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"59cd4","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"650f2","text":"The script takes three required positional inputs (in this specific order): fastq path, workflow, and primer bed file. The script infers sample name from the sequencing read fastq filenames.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"325ct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5fvun","text":"FASTQ_PATH: relative or absolute path to directory containing fastq files","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cdq5v","text":"Optional parameters to modify how the script looks for and processes fastq files:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fmdjc","text":"        -f, --fastq_ext: .fastq.gz file extension is removed to infer sample name","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v2aa","text":"        --fastq_separator: underscore is used to infer where the sample name is. i.e. _1 or _2 is removed ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"agisb","text":"        --fastq_pattern: .fastq.gz read files are looked for. If you want to change it to look for fastqs, you would put '*.fastq'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e5t11","text":"      (do not forget the single quotes or the wildcard will expand and substitute the files names)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7gton","text":"        --pe[1/2]_pattern: specifies how to differentiate between left and right reads. Accepts R1/2, r1/2, 1/2, A/B, a/b ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7gb5","text":"        -r, --recursive: look not only in current folder for reads files but all folders in this folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"be19s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6gjst","text":"WORKFLOW: What workflow to run","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dh6md","text":"Options: clearlabs, illumina_pe, illumina_se, ont","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"85bno","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fcvg1","text":"PRIMER: relative or absolute paths accepted for location of primer bed file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7j6em","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5irbj","text":"Optional parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f8083","text":"        --pangolin_docker: specify docker tag for version of pangolin you want to run; not compatible with --tsv","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":86,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7alao","text":"        --params: relative or absolute paths accepted for location of params.json; not compatible with --tsv","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":83,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ff35b","text":"        example params.json: default params","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":29,"length":14}],"data":[]},{"key":"99f5u","text":"        --tsv: this specifies the output file format. Default is the JSON file format. JSON is used to run the titan-gc directly, and TSV is used for Nextflow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fe60g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7j62h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2toqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rh9j","text":"Note: samples prepared together will be run with the same workflow. If you need to run different workflows, prepare separate input files for each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":146}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ed7v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"k7mh","text":"Example command: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6v8jm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"595bu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2a9tv","text":"Example JSON input file creation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"94akv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"12e3r","text":"Note that the "." (period) in the first line of the example below indicates that the current directory should be used as FASTQ_PATH. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":132}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fitdb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"74vq8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ev88a","text":"Example TSV input file/FOFN (File of file names) creation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"16ok7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3fb02","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ae2cr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"13ph0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5F7D8EF9E3FF11EB90C60A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/artic-network/primer-schemes/tree/master/nCoV-2019"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9518,"name":"(titan-cli) [me@PC ~]$ titan-gc-prepare.py
usage: titan-gc-prepare [-h] [-f STR] [--fastq_separator STR]
                        [--fastq_pattern STR] [--pe1_pattern STR]
                        [--pe2_pattern STR] [-r] [--prefix STR] [--tsv]
                        [--pangolin_docker STR] [--params STR]
                        FASTQ_PATH WORKFLOW PRIMER

titan-gc-prepare - Read a directory and prepare a JSON for input to Titan GC

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit

Titan-GC Prepare Parameters:
  FASTQ_PATH            Directory where FASTQ files are stored
  WORKFLOW              The Titan-GC workflow to use for analysis. Options:
                        clearlabs, illumina_pe, illumina_se, ont
  PRIMER                A file containing primers (bed format) used during
                        sequencing.
  -f STR, --fastq_ext STR
                        Extension of the FASTQs. Default: .fastq.gz
  --fastq_separator STR
                        Split FASTQ name on the last occurrence of the
                        separator. Default: _
  --fastq_pattern STR   Glob pattern to match FASTQs. Default: *.fastq.gz
  --pe1_pattern STR     Designates difference first set of paired-end reads.
                        Default: ([Aa]|[Rr]1|1) (R1, r1, 1, A, a)
  --pe2_pattern STR     Designates difference second set of paired-end reads.
                        Default: ([Bb]|[Rr]2|2) (R2, r2, 2, AB b)
  -r, --recursive       Directories will be traversed recursively
  --prefix STR          Replace the absolute path with a given string.
                        Default: Use absolute path
  --tsv                 Output FOFN as a TSV (Default JSON)

Optional Titan-GC Workflow Parameters:
  --pangolin_docker STR
                        Docker image used to run Pangolin (takes priority over
                        --params)
  --params STR          A JSON file containing parameter values","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"5F690670E65111EBB8EF1B24B4091DB7"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E7713F8EE01311EBA3380A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rpetit3/public_health_viral_genomics/rp3-titan-cli/conf/params.json"}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":8,"offset":112}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":27,"style":"bold"},{"length":6,"offset":47,"style":"bold"}],"key":"fsd7m","text":"For more details about the --tsv option, go to Step 3 to learn more about running titan-gc directly or with the Nextflow workflow wrapper.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"1D98CC60277611ECB27AB7017A6B1B5B","url":"https://www.nextflow.io/"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}},"4":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9519,"name":"titan-gc-prepare.py ./reads_dir illumina_pe ./primer.bed > input.file","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"7666CA90E02211EBBED489DD2CD6CE03"}},"5":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9520,"name":"(titan-cli) [me@PC test_seq]$ titan-gc-prepare.py . illumina_pe /$PATH/arctic_V3_nCov-2019.bed > input.json
(titan-cli) [me@PC test_seq]$ cat input.json
{
    "titan_gc.samples": [
        {
            "sample": "SRR13422799",
            "titan_wf": "illumina_pe",
            "r1": "/$PATH/SRR13422799_1.fastq.gz",
            "r2": "/$PATH/SRR13422799_2.fastq.gz",
            "primers": "/$PATH/arctic_V3_nCov-2019.bed"
        }
    ]
}","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":"Note: $PATH just a placeholder and will have to be changed to your path to the files.","can_edit":0,"guid":"658F5960E3F811EBADDFED52ABB0491B"}},"6":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9517,"name":"(titan-cli) [me@PC test_seq]$ titan-gc-prepare.py . illumina_pe /$PATH/arctic_V3_nCov-2019.bed --tsv > input.txt
(titan-cli) [me@PC test_seq]$ cat input.txt
sample  titan_wf        r1      r2      primers
SRR13422799     illumina_pe     /$PATH/test_seq/SRR13422799_1.fastq.gz       /$PATH/test_seq/SRR13422799_2.fastq.gz        /$PATH/arctic_V3_nCov-2019.bed","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":"$PATH just placeholder and will need to be changed with your path to the files","can_edit":0,"guid":"EFEBEFA0E0ED11EBB04BC7EB28338F1C"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fbv8r","text":"The titan-gc pipeline can be run two different ways:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1kcah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"doa8l","text":"Directly (Step 3.1)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e9see","text":"With Nextflow (Step 3.2)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"96eos","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8e68q","text":"Differences between the two implementations are primarily related to call-caching (how samples are submitted to the pipeline), job submission, and STDOUT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cncne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cagrd","text":"Call-caching: The Nextflow wrapper offers the benefits of call-caching, essentially allowing failed runs to be resumed without rerunning finished analyses. This saves time and compute resources. Running the pipeline directly (Step 3.1) uses cromwell run, and call-caching is only available from Cromwell's server mode, which will retry failed processes 10 times before the workflow is aborted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":241,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":306,"length":11}],"data":[]},{"key":"8p7o4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cpdl1","text":"Job submission: The Nextflow wrapper individually submits each sample to the Titan workflow. If one sample fails, downstream samples are not affected. Alternatively, when running the pipeline directly (Step 3.1), failed samples can cause the entire workflow to abort before remaining subsequently queued samples can be run to completion. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dkqb0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e82bs","text":"STDOUT: The Nextflow wrapper outputs little information, but provide a summary message to report the number of samples finished before merging results. Running the pipeline directly can output all of Cromwell's very extensive run logs to STDOUT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"20cad","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"sdn5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3E401B60E64611EBAF9369B6E497D626","url":"https://cromwell.readthedocs.io/en/stable/"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"566C7620E64611EBAF9369B6E497D626","url":"https://cromwell.readthedocs.io/en/stable/tutorials/ServerMode/"}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":121,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"641h8","text":"Note: the first time you run the pipeline, it will pull all the containers, a process that can take up to 20-30 minutes. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eudn1","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":11,"offset":4,"style":"bold"}],"key":"264uq","text":"For Singularity, the default cache directory is \"~/.singularity/cache\".","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"de7k7","text":"You can change this with command:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1g5d2","text":"    \"export SINGULARITY_CACHEDIR=/path/to/newcache\" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d1jnc","text":"    (this must be added to your \"~/.bashrc\" file to make the change permanent)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fmkee","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":4,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4hq1l","text":"For Docker, the default cache directory is \"/var/lib/docker\". Changing the cache directory for Docker is more complicated, requiring edits to a config file, and will not be discussed in this protocol.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e517u","text":"Running pipeline directly:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1m8cm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6bfgm","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3aql7","text":"The command takes two required inputs: input JSON file and output directory","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b50or","text":"    -i: relative or absolute path to input JSON file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2lh0b","text":"    -o: relative or absolute path to output directory","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97pbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e3r7c","text":"Optional parameters: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"adhp7","text":"    --profile: what container software to use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ks3c","text":"        options: docker(default), singularity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"466kn","text":"    --options: provide JSON file to modify cromwell run attributes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ml9r","text":"        More info about config options can be found at https://cromwell.readthedocs.io/en/stable/Configuring/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":55,"length":54}],"data":[]},{"key":"aa6em","text":"    --quiet: Silence output from running the pipeline","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2cj7e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d8jrk","text":"Example command:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b8obm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7kh02","text":"The running pipeline should produce extensive text output of Cromwall's run information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aui4l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3afto","text":"If a sample fails, because Cromwell provides no call-caching, there are no options except to rerun the sample. If the input.json file included multiple samples some may have successfully completed before the workflow aborted and a new input.json should be prepared for rerunning only the failed samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":111,"length":192}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2r3i9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9521,"name":"(titan-cli) [me@PC ~]$ titan-gc --help
usage: titan-gc [-h] [-i STR] [--inputs STR] [-o STR] [--outdir STR] [--options STR] [--quiet]

titan-gc-cli - Run Titan GC on a set of samples.

required arguments:
  -i STR, --inputs STR  The JSON file to be used with Cromwell for inputs.
  -o STR, --outdir STR  Output directory to store the final results in.

optional arguments:
  -h, --help              Show this help message and exit
  --options STR           JSON file containing Cromwell options
  --profile STR           The backend profile to use [options: docker, singularity]
  --config STR            Custom backend profile to use
  --cromwell_jar STR      Path to cromwell.jar (Default use conda install)
  --quiet                 Silence all STDOUT from Cromwell and titan-gc-organize","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"9FB104D0E65111EBB8EF1B24B4091DB7"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8EC3E7A4E33B11EB8CCA0A58A9FEAC02","height":163.45454545454544,"id":121702,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bg6d8","text":"Help message for titan-gc-cli","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy5ibkes7.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy5gbkes7.jpg","type":1,"url":"https://cromwell.readthedocs.io/en/stable/Configuring","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy5hbkes7.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy5fbkes7.webp","width":580}},"2":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9522,"name":"titan-gc -i input.json -o titan-out --profile singularity","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"8EC3E8ACE33B11EB8CCA0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bnqf9","text":"Acquire the Nextflow wrapper here: https://gitlab.com/steamboat/titan-nf/-/tree/main.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":49}],"data":[]},{"key":"9q8mn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1j7sj","text":"DISCLAIMER: The titan-nf Nextflow wrapper is not officially supported by the Titan development team and is a separate activity supported by Robert Petit in Wyoming. This workflow is under active development and frequent updates are expected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ovrl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8dov8","text":"First, pull the Nextflow wrapper, which is not included in the Conda installation. Nexflow itself should already be installed by default. This step only needs to be completed once or whenever the Nextflow wrapper is updated. The workflow will be stored at "$HOME/.nextflow/assets/steamboat/titan-nf". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61rc5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2cp4m","text":"Note: execute while your Conda environment is active unless your system has Nextflow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":85}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f7n2r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"58uga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9j59s","text":"Running the Nextflow wrapper:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"q0ko","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5vn6k","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9gbfr","text":"The command takes one required input: input TSV file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1osqk","text":"    --samples: relative or absolute paths taken for input TSV file (created using --tsv option of titan-gc-prepare.py)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mdti","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bskbo","text":"Optional parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6cmdq","text":"    --titan_opts: relative or absolute paths accepted for location of JSON parameter file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eprks","text":"        example params.json: default params","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":29,"length":14}],"data":[]},{"key":"s163","text":"    --pangolin_docker: specify docker tag for version of pangolin you want to run","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1rgn1","text":"    --profile: what container software to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hrks","text":"        options: docker, singularity(default).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4oo2e","text":"    --outdir: directory in which output folder is created. Default is the current working directory.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bb603","text":"    --run_name: name of output folder. Default is titan-gc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"mur","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ca44s","text":"Example command:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6uo73","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"243mb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1c3n5","text":"Example of running nextflow wrapper:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e2p8k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"20sss","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4stie","text":"If a sample fails, use the -resume option to retry the sample beyond the initial number of Nextflow attempts (default: 5 times). Some failures are not reproducible, and simply rerunning may solve the issue. Completed samples will not be rerun, thanks to call-caching, so the same input file can be reused without excluding the completed sampled.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"59js","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c2dsb","text":"Read more about Nextflow -resume at: https://www.nextflow.io/blog/2019/demystifying-nextflow-resume.html","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":37,"length":67}],"data":[]},{"key":"f273d","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43jsq","text":"Example of -resume option in Nextflow:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"65jvk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3vn3s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"38tov","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"304B61BEE3FE11EB90C60A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://gitlab.com/steamboat/titan-nf/-/tree/main"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9523,"name":"nextflow pull -hub gitlab -r main steamboat/titan-nf","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"BFC5FAA7E33B11EB8CCA0A58A9FEAC02"}},"2":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9524,"name":"(titan-cli) [me@PC ~]$ nextflow run -hub gitlab -r main steamboat/titan-nf --help
N E X T F L O W  ~  version 21.04.0
Launching `steamboat/titan-nf` [berserk_ekeblad] - revision: e36cccd145 [main]

Required Parameters:
    --samples FILE          File produced by titan-gc-prepare.py (--tsv used)

Optional Parameters:
    --titan_opts FILE       A JSON file with Titan GC parameters to use.
                                Default: Use Titan-GC's defaults

    --pangolin_docker STR   The pangolin docker image to use
                                Default: Use Titan-GC's defaults

    --profile STR           Profile for Titan GC to use
                                Options: docker or singularity
                                Default: singularity

    --outdir DIR            Directory to write results to
                                Default: ./
